sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find the value of (A Δ B) × {1}. Then, find the value of A × {1} Δ B × {1}. Show that the two values are not equal, thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
